intro: Tococa racemifera, commonly known as the Amazonian coffee plant, is a shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other plants like coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit, known as a capsule, contains several seeds used in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss, Tococa racemifera is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
